1. 16 mg / kg: This is a chemical dose, where "16" is the amount of chemical, "mg" is the unit of measurement (milligram), and "kg" is the unit of mass (kilogram).
2. 600 mg / m2: This is also a chemical dose, where "600" is the amount of chemical, "mg" is the unit of measurement (milligram), and "m2" is the unit of area (square meter).

Therefore, the "chemical" entities in the paragraph are "16 mg / kg" and "600 mg / m2".
